biblStruct.note: The only oriental source considered as related to the Western legend of ‘Priester John’ is the mention of a ‘Christian king John’, identified by the Syrian chronicler Bar ʿEbroyo (1225-1286) with “Onk Khan”, the ruler of the Kereyids. The article suggests that the identification was inserted by Bar ʿEbroyo in his Syriac and Arabic chronicles based on information from European residents at the Ilkhanid court, pointing out significant similarities with William of Rubruck’s report on “Rex Iohannes” and “Unc chan”.
